conclusion: Identify the given parameters: Height of the car headlights from the ground: 92.8 cm, Radius of the hemispherical lens: R, Refractive index of the light in the hemispherical lens: n = 4/3
Determine the focal length of the paraboloid using the formula f = 1/(4n), resulting in f = 3/16 cm
Calculate the distance from the light source to the focal point F using the formula d = 1/(4n), resulting in d = 3/16 cm
Determine the length of the transparent part of the light as the distance from the light source to the focal point F, which is 92.8 cm
Calculate the length of the transparent part of the light on the lens spherical surface as the distance from the light source to the focal point F, which is 92.8 cm
The length of the transparent part of all the light entering perpendicular to MN on the lens spherical surface is 92.8 cm
